node.title: Oklahoma’s governor puts an opponent of vaccine mandates in charge of the National Guard.
node.alt: Members of the Oklahoma National Guard were deployed to the U.S. Capitol in Washington in January.
node.description: The governor, Kevin Stitt, is one of a number of Republican state officials across the country who has been fighting against President Biden’s vaccine mandates.
node.content: ["OKLAHOMA CITY \u2014 The governor of Oklahoma this week dismissed the state\u2019s highest ranking military official, a vocal backer of Covid vaccinations, replacing him with a general who immediately issued orders that contravene federal vaccine requirements for military personnel. ", "The governor, Kevin Stitt, is one of a number of Republican state officials across the country who have been fighting against President Biden\u2019s vaccine mandates, which cover federal employees, federal contractors and the military.", "The state\u2019s newly appointed adjutant general, Brig. Gen. Thomas H. Mancino, released a memo on Thursday that read, in part, \u201cI hereby order that no Oklahoma Guardsmen be required to take the Covid-19 vaccine, notwithstanding any other federal requirement.\u201d", "The memo also noted that the state would continue to consider applications for vaccine exemptions, though so far federal military authorities have granted very few. It also said, \u201cno negative administrative or legal action will be taken against Guardsmen who refuse the Covid-19 vaccine.\u201d", "It remained unclear if General Mancino\u2019s policy would run afoul of the Pentagon\u2019s vaccine mandate. In August, the secretary of defense, Lloyd J. Austin III, said all active-duty military members must immediately get a Covid-19 vaccine. The directive covered members of the armed forces \u201con active duty or in the Ready Reserve, including the National Guard.\u201d", "General Mancino issued the memo a day after Mr. Stitt unexpectedly dismissed Maj. Gen. Michael C. Thompson as adjutant general.", "General Thompson, a 38-year military veteran and the Army state guard\u2019s first Black general, said that Mr. Stitt had been pressuring the state\u2019s military officials to counter the federal vaccine requirements and said that his own stance was to instead warn state troops that there \u201care consequences\u201d for refusing the vaccination order.", "He said the governor offered no explanation when he called Wednesday to relieve him of command.", "\u201cIt\u2019s political,\u201d General Thompson said. \u201cThere\u2019s not another reason for it.\u201d", "The governor\u2019s office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.", "General Thompson said the lack of vaccinations would negatively affect the National Guard\u2019s troop readiness. \u201cI hate to see us not meet the mark when we need to,\u201d he added.", "Lt. Col. Geoff Legler, the public affairs officer for the Oklahoma National Guard, said that Mr. Stitt was operating on the principle that he had \u201ccomplete control\u201d of the force within the state.", "However, the officer noted, National Guard members who attend federally funded schools in Oklahoma were still subject to the federal vaccinate mandate."]
